member.name: T:SunSharp.Diagnostics.ILogger
member.summary: To be used for logging method calls and their parameters/results. Potentially useful for debugging interop issues. Used in tandem with .

member.name: T:SunSharp.Diagnostics.SunVoxLibWithLogger
member.summary: Provides a wrapper for SunVox library operations that includes logging capabilities.
member.remarks: This class combines SunVox library functionality with an injected logger to record operations and errors. Use this type when you need to track SunVox API usage or diagnose issues through logging. All SunVox interactions performed via this wrapper will be logged using the provided logger instance.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Effect
member.summary: Represents various effects that can be applied to notes or tracks in the SunVox pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.None
member.summary: No effect applied.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SlideUp
member.summary: Slide up (portamento up). Sliding speed = XXYY. Can use the last nonzero parameter when XXYY = 0x0000.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SlideDown
member.summary: Slide down (portamento down). Sliding speed = XXYY. Can use the last nonzero parameter when XXYY = 0x0000.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SlideToNote
member.summary: Slide to note. Sliding speed = XXYY. Can use the last nonzero parameter when XXYY = 0x0000.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.Vibrato
member.summary: Vibrato. XX - frequency; YY - amplitude. Can use the last nonzero parameter when XXYY = 0x0000.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PitchBendUp
member.summary: Pitch bend up: pitch = original pitch (initialized when a note is activated) + XXYY. One semitone = 0x0100.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PitchBendDown
member.summary: Pitch bend down: pitch = original pitch (initialized when a note is activated) - XXYY. One semitone = 0x0100.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetPhasePercents
member.summary: Set phase (or sample offset) XXYY in percents (from 0x0000 (0%) to 0x8000 (100%)).

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.Arpeggio
member.summary: Arpeggio. XX - second note increment; YY - third note increment.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetPhase
member.summary: Set phase (or sample offset) XXYY in samples*0x0100.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.VelocitySlide
member.summary: Velocity slide up/down. XX - up speed; YY - down speed. Can use the last nonzero parameter when XXYY = 0x0000.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetPlayingSpeed
F:SunSharp.Effect.FineSlideUp
member.summary: Fine slide up. XXYY specifies the amount.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.FineSlideDown
member.summary: Fine slide down. XXYY specifies the amount.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetBypassSoloMute
member.summary: Set Bypass/Solo/Mute (BSM = XYY) flags. Bypass - 0x0100; Solo - 0x0010; Mute - 0x0001.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.ResetBypassSoloMute
member.summary: Reset Bypass/Solo/Mute (BSM = XYY) flags. Bypass - 0x0100; Solo - 0x0010; Mute - 0x0001.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.ChangeModuleFineTune
F:SunSharp.Effect.Retrigger
member.summary: Retrigger note after XXYY ticks during the line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.FineVelocitySlide
member.summary: Fine velocity slide up/down. XX - up speed; YY - down speed. Applied once at the beginning of a line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.CutNote
member.summary: Cut note after YY ticks in the current line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.DelayNote
member.summary: Delay the start of note until tick YY in the current line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetBpm
member.summary: Set BPM to XXYY.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.NoteProbability
member.summary: Note probability. XXYY specifies the probability.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.NoteProbabilityRandomVelocity
member.summary: Note probability with random velocity. XXYY specifies the probability.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetControllerRandomAbsolute
member.summary: Set controller value to a random number from 0x0000 to XXYY.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetControllerRandomRange
member.summary: Set controller value to a random number with range from XX (0x00 to 0xFF) to YY (0x00 to 0xFF).

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayNoteFromLine
member.summary: Take a note from line XXYY on the same track.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayRandomNoteFromRange
member.summary: Take a random note from the range of lines XX..YY (inclusive) on the same track.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayNoteRandomTrackSameLine
member.summary: Take a note from track XXYY on the same line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayRandomNoteFromRangeTracksSameLine
member.summary: Take a random note from the range of tracks XX..YY (inclusive) on the same line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayNoteFromLineOnTrackZero
member.summary: Take a note from line XXYY on track 0x0.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.PlayRandomNoteFromRangeOnTrackZero
member.summary: Take a random note from the range of lines XX..YY (inclusive) on track 0x0.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.StopPlaying
member.summary: Stop playing the song.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.Jump
member.summary: Jump to line XXYY (address) right after the end of the current line.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetJumpMode
F:SunSharp.Effect.SlotSync
member.summary: Slot sync (for sv_sync_resume() in SunVox library).

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.SetResetProjectOptions
F:SunSharp.Effect.BindMidiOut
member.summary: Bind MIDI OUT message XX (0x0 - Program Change; 0x1 - Channel Pressure; 0x2 - Pitch Bend Change) to controller YY (0x0 - OFF; 0x80 - MIDI controller 0x0; 0x81 - MIDI controller 0x1...). For the specified module only.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.DeleteEventOnTrackWithProbability
member.summary: Delete an event on track XX with a probability of YY (0x00 to 0xFF (100%)). Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.CyclicShiftTrackLines
member.summary: Cyclic shift of track XX down by YY lines. Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.GeneratePolyrhythm
member.summary: Generate a new iteration of YY-line polyrhythm on track XX. Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.CopyTrackToPattern
member.summary: Copy track XX to the pattern named YY. Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.CopyTrackFromPattern
member.summary: Copy track XX from the pattern YY. For example, if XXYY = 0x0023, then the first track will be copied from the pattern named "23". Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Effect.WriteRandomValue
member.summary: Write a random value to track YY. Min value, max value and column must be in track 0x0, starting from line XX. Destructive effect - irreversibly changes the contents of the pattern.

member.name: M:SunSharp.EffectExtensions.IsNonLinear(SunSharp.Effect)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified effect is non-linear.
member.remarks: Non-linear effects are those that alter the normal sequential flow of pattern playback, such as jumps or stops, rather than modifying the sound or parameters of the notes being played.

member.name: M:SunSharp.EffectExtensions.IsDestructive(SunSharp.Effect)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified effect is destructive.
member.remarks: Destructive effects are those that can remove or overwrite existing data in the pattern, potentially leading to loss of information. The effects considered destructive include deleting events, shifting track lines, generating polyrhythms, copying tracks, and writing random values.

member.name: M:SunSharp.EffectExtensions.ChangesTempo(SunSharp.Effect)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified effect changes the tempo.
member.remarks: Tempo-changing effects are those that modify the speed or BPM (beats per minute) of the playback.

member.name: M:SunSharp.EffectExtensions.IsEventDelay(SunSharp.Effect)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified effect is an event delay effect.
member.remarks: Event delay effects (0x40 to 0x5F) delay an event for a selected fraction of the line, from 0% to 96.875%.

member.name: F:SunSharp.ControllerType.Normal
member.summary: Volume, frequency, resonance and other parameters with a continuous scale. In pattern events the value takes the whole range that is then mapped to the real parameter range.

member.name: F:SunSharp.ControllerType.Selector
member.summary: Number of harmonics, waveform type, etc. In pattern events the value is an index of a discrete set of values.

member.name: F:SunSharp.SunVoxInitOptions.NoDebugOutput
member.summary: Less information will be written to standard output.

member.name: F:SunSharp.SunVoxInitOptions.UserAudioCallback
member.summary: No automatic sound management, sv_audio_callback must be used.

member.name: F:SunSharp.SunVoxInitOptions.AudioInt16
member.summary: Sets the format which must be used with sv_audio_callback to . May not apply without . Mutually exclusive with .

member.name: F:SunSharp.SunVoxInitOptions.AudioFloat32
member.summary: Sets the format which must be used with sv_audio_callback to . May not apply without . Mutually exclusive with .

member.name: F:SunSharp.SunVoxInitOptions.OneThread
member.summary: Audio callback and other methods will be called from one thread. Applies if is set.

member.name: T:SunSharp.FineTunePair
member.summary: Represents a pair of fine-tune and relative note adjustment values. Used for per-module configuration.

member.name: P:SunSharp.FineTunePair.FineTune
member.summary: The fine-tune adjustment value. The value range is -0x0100 (-1 semitone) to 0x0100 (+1 semitone).

member.name: P:SunSharp.FineTunePair.RelativeNote
member.summary: The relative note adjustment in semitones.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Microtones
member.summary: Provides conversion methods between SunVox pitch values and frequencies in Hz.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Microtones.PitchToFrequency(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a SunVox pitch value to frequency in Hz.
member.exception: Thrown when pitch results in an invalid frequency.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Microtones.FrequencyToPitch(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a frequency in Hz to a SunVox pitch value.
member.exception: Thrown when frequency is not a positive finite number.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Microtones.NoteToPitch(SunSharp.NoteName,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a musical note name and octave to a SunVox pitch value.
member.returns: The SunVox pitch value corresponding to the given note and octave.
member.remarks: Supported range is from C0 (0x7800) to C10 (0x0000).

member.name: T:SunSharp.ModuleFlags

member.name: P:SunSharp.ModuleFlags.Generator
member.summary: Whether this module receives notes and outputs sound.

member.name: P:SunSharp.ModuleFlags.Effect
member.summary: Whether this module receives sound and outputs sound.

member.name: P:SunSharp.ModuleFlags.InputUpperCount
member.summary: Upper count of inputs connected to this module at this time.
member.remarks: The actual input count may be less or equal to this value. Does not inform about a module's maximum input capacity.

member.name: P:SunSharp.ModuleFlags.OutputUpperCount
member.summary: Upper count of outputs connected to this module at this time.
member.remarks: The actual input count may be less or equal to this value. Does not inform about a module's maximum output capacity.

member.summary: After receiving the first note, the MetaModule will start playing its internal project in a loop; after receiving the last release of the note, the MetaModule will stop playing.

member.summary: Same as OnRepeat mode, but the project is played only once.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.ModulationType
member.summary: Modulator modulation types.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.ModulationType.Phase
member.summary: Default signal delay (when modulating inputs are silent) = 20ms; delay range: 40ms (mod.amp >= 1) ... 20ms (mod.amp = 0) ... 0ms (mod.amp <= -1).

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.ModulationType.PhaseAbsolute
member.summary: Absolute amplitude values will be used. Default signal delay (when modulating inputs are silent) = 0ms; delay range: 40ms (mod.amp >= 1) ... 0ms (mod.amp = 0) ... 40ms (mod.amp <= -1).

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorAlgorithm
member.summary: Pitch Detector algorithm types.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorAlgorithm.FastZeroCrossing
member.summary: For basic periodic waveforms (sine, triangle, saw, square); the fastest with the lowest latency.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorAlgorithm.Autocorrelation
member.summary: For sounds with a complex spectrum.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorAlgorithm.Cepstrum
member.summary: For sounds with a complex spectrum; compared to autocorrelation, it performs worse at low frequencies and better at high frequencies.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorAlgSampleRate
member.summary: Pitch Detector sampling rate for algorithms 1 and 2. A lower value will reduce the CPU load, but also reduce the quality of detection.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.PitchDetectorBufferSize
member.summary: Pitch Detector buffer size for algorithms 1 and 2. Less buffer size = less latency; larger buffer size = better detection quality.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.PitchShifterBypassMode
member.summary: Pitch Shifter bypass modes when pitch is zero.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.PitchToControlMode
member.summary: Pitch2Ctl conversion modes.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.PitchToControlMode.FrequencyHz
member.summary: Use frequency (in Hz) of the incoming notes.

member.name: F:SunSharp.Modules.PitchToControlMode.Pitch
member.summary: Use linear pitch (first note ... first note + number of semitones) of the incoming notes.

The curve contains 32 values in range of -1 to 1.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Modules.IFmModuleHandle
member.summary: Frequency Modulation (FM) Synthesizer. Each voice of polyphony includes two operators with ADSR envelopes: 1) C (carrier) - base sine wave generator; 2) M (modulator) - sine wave that changes the frequency of the first operator. The sound quality of this module is better at a sample rate of 44100Hz.

summary.para: This is a helper method to automatically handle turning target controller values into column values.
For this controller the input value is mapped from displayed range (0 to 8000) to column range (0 to 0x8000). Out of range values are clamped.

Write to curve 0 of Fmx.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IGeneratorModuleHandle.WriteCurveSynth(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Used for 'Drawn', 'DrawnSpline' and 'Harmonics' waveforms.
Write to curve 0 of Generator.
The curve contains 32 values in range of -1 to 1.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IGeneratorModuleHandle.ReadCurveSynth(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Used for 'Drawn', 'DrawnSpline' and 'Harmonics' waveforms.
Read from curve 0 of Generator.
The curve contains 32 values in range of -1 to 1.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMetaModuleModuleHandle.MakeUserControllerEvent``1(System.Int32,``0)
member.summary:
Make a pattern event that sets a user-defined controller value. User-defined controllers start at index 5.
This overload allows for any enum value to be used.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMetaModuleModuleHandle.MakeUserControllerEvent(System.Int32,System.UInt16)
member.summary:
Make a pattern event that sets a user-defined controller value. User-defined controllers start at index 5.
This overload allows for raw column values to be used. Values are clamped to the 0x0 to 0x8000 range.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMetaModuleModuleHandle.MakeUserControllerEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Make a pattern event that sets a user-defined controller value. User-defined controllers start at index 5.
This overload allows for using display-values, as long as offset, min and max values of the controller are known..

member.summary:
Velocity to apply to arriving note.
Read from curve 0 of MultiSynth.
The curve contains 128 values in range of 0 to 1.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMultiSynthModuleHandle.WriteCurveVelocityToVelocity(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Map velocity values.

The curve contains 257 values in range of 0 to 1.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMultiSynthModuleHandle.ReadCurveVelocityToVelocity(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Map velocity values.
Read from curve 1 of MultiSynth.
The curve contains 257 values in range of 0 to 1.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMultiSynthModuleHandle.WriteCurveNoteToPitch(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Map incoming note to a pitch value.

The curve contains 128 values in range of 0.2500038 to 0.74610513.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Modules.IMultiSynthModuleHandle.ReadCurveNoteToPitch(System.Single[])
member.summary:
Map incoming note to a pitch value.
Read from curve 2 of MultiSynth.
The curve contains 128 values in range of 0.2500038 to 0.74610513.

The curve contains 256 values in range of 0 to 1.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for loading and managing native library handles. Used to load native libraries, retrieve function pointers, and unload libraries when no longer needed. Used by the class.
member.remarks: You may implement this interface to create custom library loading mechanisms, if necessary for your platform or application requirements. See the implementation in the SunSharp.Redistribution package for reference.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler.IsLibraryLoaded
member.summary: Whether the native library is currently loaded.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler.LoadLibrary
member.summary: Loads the native library from the file system and prepares it for use.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler.UnloadLibrary
member.summary: Unloads the native library if it is currently loaded and releases any associated unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler.GetFunctionByName(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Retrieves a managed delegate for an exported function from the loaded library.
member.param: The name of the exported function to retrieve.
The delegate type that matches the function signature.
member.returns: A delegate instance that can be used to invoke the native function.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy
member.summary: Provides a thread-safe proxy for loading and managing native library function delegates.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.#ctor(SunSharp.Native.Loader.ILibraryHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The library handler responsible for loading and unloading the native library.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.IsProxyLoaded
member.summary: Whether the proxy has loaded all function delegates from the native library.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.IsLibraryLoaded
member.summary: Whether the underlying native library is currently loaded.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.IsReady
member.summary: Whether the proxy is fully ready to use, i.e., both the native library and all function delegates are loaded.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.AsNativeLibrary
member.summary: Returns the current instance as an object implementing the ISunVoxLibC interface.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.Load
member.summary: Loads the native library if necessary and initializes all function delegates.
member.exception: Thrown when both loading and cleanup fail.
member.remarks: This operation is thread-safe and idempotent. If both the library and proxy are already loaded, this method returns immediately.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.Loader.NativeProxy.Unload
member.summary: Deinitializes the SunVox engine, unloads all function delegates, and unloads the native library if loaded.

remarks.para: This operation is thread-safe. Delegates are set to null before calling to prevent access from other threads.

This method passes exceptions thrown during deinitialization or unloading to the caller. This requires careful handling, as there is risk of unmanaged resources not being released properly. If fails, the issue may be unrecoverable.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib
member.summary: Friendlier interface for SunVox native library functions.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.AudioCallback(System.Single[],SunSharp.AudioChannels,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get the next piece of audio from the Output module.
member.param: Output buffer to write audio data to.
Number of channels the library was initialized with.
Buffer output time in system ticks. See .
member.returns: if buffer contains any non-0 samples.
member.exception: Thrown when buffer size is invalid for the channel count.
member.remarks:
must be set in to use this function.
Make sure to call the correct overload for the buffer data type.
Calls .

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.AudioCallback(System.Single[],SunSharp.AudioChannels,System.Single[],SunSharp.AudioChannels,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Send audio to the Input module and get the next piece of audio from the Output module.
member.param: Output buffer to write audio data to.
Number of channels the library was initialized with.
Input buffer. Stereo data must be interleaved.
Buffer output time in system ticks. See .
member.returns: if buffer contains any non-0 samples.
member.exception: Thrown when buffer sizes are invalid for the channel count or not equal length.
member.remarks:
must be set in to use this function.
Calls .

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.GetTicks
member.summary: Get the current system tick counter.
member.remarks:
SunVox engine uses system-provided time space, measured in system ticks (don't confuse it with the project ticks). System ticks are used for timing in functions like and .

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.LockSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Lock the slot for thread-safe access. Use when reading/modifying SunVox data from different threads on the same slot. Some functions require lock/unlock. Remember to call !
member.remarks:
The library uses a recursive mutex, so the same thread may call multiple times without deadlocking itself.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.SetEventTiming(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the timestamp of events sent by . Every event has a timestamp (when it was generated, e.g., key press time). If nonzero: event is heard at timestamp + sound latency * 2.
member.param: Timestamp (in system ticks) for future events. If not zero, must be previous value for same slot. See and .

member.name: M:SunSharp.Native.SunVoxLib.ResetEventTiming(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reset the timestamp of events sent by . If timestamp is zero: event is heard as quickly as possible.

member.summary: Stop playing. First call stops playback. The sound engine continues working (e.g., reverb tail may be heard). Second call resets all activity and enters standby mode.

member.name: T:SunSharp.Note
member.summary: Represents a musical note or command in the SunVox pattern format. This structure encapsulates both standard musical notes (C0-F#10) and special commands like note off, stop, play, etc.
member.remarks:
The note value is stored as a single byte where:
0 = Nothing/Silence
1-127 = Musical notes (C0 = 1, C#0 = 2, ..., F#10 = 127)
128+ = Special commands (note off, stop, play, etc.)

member.name: F:SunSharp.Note.Value
member.summary: The raw byte value of the note.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Nothing
member.summary: Does nothing.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Off
member.summary: Stops the note playing on its track.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.AllNotesOff
member.summary: Sends "note off" to all modules.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.CleanSynths
member.summary: Stops all modules, clears their internal buffers and puts them into standby mode.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Stop
member.summary: Stops playing the project.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the project.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.SetPitch
member.summary: Sets the pitch specified in column XXYY, where 0x0000 - highest possible pitch, 0x7800 -lowest pitch (note C0); one semitone = 0x100.
member.remarks: Consider using the helper class for pitch conversions.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.CleanModule
member.summary: Stops the module, clears its internal buffers and puts it into standby mode.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.PreviousTrack
member.summary: Used to apply effects to the previous track.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Name
member.summary: Get the name of the note. Returns valid values for notes in range C0 to F#10 inclusive. Returns otherwise.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.Octave
member.summary: Gets the octave number of the musical note, if applicable.
member.remarks: Returns -1 if the value does not represent a musical note.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.IsMusicalNote
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a normal musical note (C0-F#10).

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.IsDisplayable
member.summary: Whether the note value can be displayed in SunVox's pattern editor. Does not include commands that don't have a visual representation.

member.name: P:SunSharp.Note.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value is considered a valid note or command in SunVox.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.#ctor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct with the specified raw byte value.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.#ctor(SunSharp.NoteName,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct with the specified note name and octave. Valid range is C0 to F#10 inclusive.
member.exception: Thrown when is not a valid note name.
Thrown when the note and octave combination is out of the supported range (C0 to F#10).

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.C(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a C note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Cs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a C# note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Db(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a D note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of C#.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.D(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a D note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Ds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a D# note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Eb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an E note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of D#.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.E(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an E note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Es(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an E# note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of F.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Fb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an F note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of E.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.F(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an F note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Fs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an F# note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Gb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a G note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of F#.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.G(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a G note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Gs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a G# note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Ab(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an A note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of G#.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.A(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an A note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.As(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an A# note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Bb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a B note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of A#.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.B(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a B note at the specified octave.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Bs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a B# note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of C in the next octave.
member.remarks: Since B is a semitone above B, it actually belongs to the next octave. For example, B3 = C4, B4 = C5, etc.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.Cb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a C note at the specified octave. Enharmonic equivalent of B in the previous octave.
member.remarks: Since C is a semitone below C, it actually belongs to the previous octave. For example, C4 = B3, C5 = B4, etc.

member.name: M:SunSharp.Note.ToString
member.summary: Returns a two-character string representation of the note.
member.remarks: The returns a two-character string representing the note or command, even if SunVox does not display it in the pattern editor.
member.returns:
A two-character string representing the note:
two empty spaces for nothing/silence
"--" for
"-!" for
"CS" for
"CM" for
"S!" for
"P!" for
"SP" for
Note name and octave (e.g., "C4", "d5") for musical notes
"??" for unknown/invalid values

member.name: T:SunSharp.NoteNameExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the enum.

member.name: M:SunSharp.NoteNameExtensions.GetNoteCharacterAsDisplayed(SunSharp.NoteName)
member.summary: Returns the character representation of the specified note as displayed in SunVox.
member.remarks: Only valid for note names in the range of C to B, and defaults to '?' for others. In case of accidentals, returns the lowercase character for sharp notes. You are likely looking for for full note representation.

member.name: M:SunSharp.NoteNameExtensions.IsValidNoteName(SunSharp.NoteName)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified note name is a valid note name.

member.name: T:SunSharp.PatternEvent
member.summary: Represents a SunVox pattern event that encodes music commands such as notes, effects, and controller changes in a compact 64-bit format.
member.remarks: For better readability, consider using the property accessors and factory methods provided.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Data
member.summary: Raw 64-bit data representing the entire event.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.NN
member.summary: Note number or special command. Consider using instead.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.VV
member.summary: Raw velocity value (actual velocity + 1). A value of 0 indicates default velocity should be used. Consider using property instead for automatic offset handling.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.MM
member.summary: Raw module number (actual module ID + 1). A value of 0 indicates no module is targeted. Consider using property instead for automatic offset handling.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.CCEE
member.summary: Combined controller and effect code as a 16-bit value (high byte = CC, low byte = EE). Consider using and properties instead for better readability.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.EE
member.summary: Raw effect code (low byte of CCEE). Consider using property instead for type-safe effect handling.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.CC
member.summary: Raw controller number (high byte of CCEE, actual controller + 1). Consider using property instead for automatic offset handling.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.XXYY
member.summary: Combined 16-bit parameter value (low byte = XX, high byte = YY).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.YY
member.summary: High byte of parameter value (upper 8 bits of XXYY).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.XX
member.summary: Low byte of parameter value (lower 8 bits of XXYY).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Note
member.summary: Note value. Allows for explicit note commands.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Velocity
member.summary: Note velocity. Returns null when default velocity is used. Automatically handles the +1 offset used in raw data.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.ModuleId
member.summary: Module identifier (0-based). Returns null when no module is specified. Automatically handles the +1 offset used in raw data.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Effect
member.summary: Pattern event effect code.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.ControllerId
member.summary: Controller identifier (0-based). Returns when no controller is specified. Module controllers: 0-126 (raw data: 1-127). MIDI controllers: 127+ (raw data: 0x80+). Automatically handles the +1 offset used in raw data.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Value
member.summary:
Parameter value for controller or effect (16-bit unsigned integer).
Range: 0-32768 (0x8000) for controllers, 0-65535 (0xFFFF) for effects.
For pitch commands: 0x0000 = highest pitch, 0x7800 = C0, 0x100 = one semitone.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasNote
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event contains a note command (musical note or special command).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasVelocity
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event contains an explicit velocity value (not using default).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasModule
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event targets a specific module.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasController
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event contains a controller change.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasEffect
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event contains an effect command.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.HasValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this event contains a non-zero parameter value.

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.IsEmpty
member.summary: Whether this is an empty event (all fields zero).

member.name: P:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Empty
member.summary: Gets an empty pattern event with all fields set to zero (represents a blank pattern cell).

Velocity value (0-128). Use for default velocity.
member.returns: A new configured as a set pitch event.

member.summary: Creates a Set Pitch event by converting a frequency in Hz to the appropriate pitch value.
member.param: Velocity value (0-128). Use for default velocity.
member.returns: A new with the calculated pitch value.

member.name: M:SunSharp.PatternEvent.NewEvent(SunSharp.Note,System.Nullable{System.Byte},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Byte},SunSharp.Effect,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Creates a new generic pattern event with optional parameters for flexible event construction.
member.returns: A new with the specified fields.
member.remarks: This method provides maximum flexibility for creating events. For common scenarios, consider using specific factory methods like , , etc.

member.name: M:SunSharp.PatternEvent.Merge(SunSharp.PatternEvent,SunSharp.PatternEvent)
member.summary: Merges two events, with non-zero values from overwriting corresponding values in .
member.param: The base event providing default values.
The event whose non-zero fields override the base event.
member.remarks: This performs a field-by-field merge where any non-zero field in replaces the corresponding field in . Useful for layering pattern data or applying partial updates.

member.name: F:SunSharp.PatternEvent.PatternEventHeaderString
member.summary: Column header string for pattern display: "NNVVMMMMCCEEXXYY".
member.remarks: Primarily used for formatting pattern output in tracker-style displays.

member.name: M:SunSharp.PatternEvent.ToString
member.summary: Returns hexadecimal string representation that roughly follows the SunVox format. Empty fields shown as spaces.
member.remarks:
Some examples of the output format:
"C4__00001________" - Note C4 on module 0, no velocity, no effect/controller/value.
"__64__0001_02_1000" - Velocity 100 on module 0, controller 2 set to 4096.
Keep in mind:
Module number (MMMM) is as displayed in SunVox, incremented by one compared to library-side module IDs
CC and EE are independent, unlike in SunVox
CC is as displayed in SunVox, incremented by one compared to library-side module IDs
Note: spaces were replaced with underscores for better visibility in the examples.
